SEARCH

Class Dealer

java.lang.Object
Dealer
public class Dealer extends Object
This class handles each round and the actual game in of itself. Like its name suggests, the Dealer class handles setting the hands for each player every round, responding to their requests to hit or stand, or to the trump cards they play. At the end of every round (through the deal() method), it returns a code depending on who won, or if it was a draw, and has the capability to punish the loser of the game.

    • deal

      public int deal()
      Handles a round of 21. Resets Deck, shuffles, deals cards to both players and randomly decides who goes first. Gets input for each player, and handles each action accordingly using the handleAction method. Continues until both stands, then decides the winner, returning an int based on who wins the round.
      Returns:
      int signifying result (0 = draw, 1 = p1 wins, 2 = p2 wins)

    • handleAction

      public void handleAction(Player activePlayer, int code)
      takes in the parameter of a player and a code (symbolizing action of the player to either hit, stand or play trump) executes result of selecting the hit, stand or playing a trump card, which can increase bet, draw a certain card, reduce bet, or change the goal
      Parameters:
      activePlayer - - Player who's action is being handled
      code - - int symbolizing action which needs to be taken

    • punish

      public void punish(Player player, int bet)
      Runs a punishment on given player and the game bet then sets the attribute of the player saying whether or not they are alive following the punishment. The value of bet determines how many shots player undergoes, the chance of player dying on each shot is given by 1 / n, where n = bet - shot number + 1
      Parameters:
      player - - Player to be punished
      bet - - int signifying how many times punishment must be executed.

    • playerWillBeEliminated

      public boolean playerWillBeEliminated()
      Returns whether or not the player being punished is/will be eliminated
      Returns:
      true if the player is/will be eliminated, false otherwise

    • getStatus

      public int getStatus()
      Returns the current status of the dealer. 0 = starting game 1 = playing the game normally 2 = punishing a player 3 = ending game
      Returns:
      the current status

    • getPunishStatus

      public int getPunishStatus()
      Returns the current status of the punishment. 0 = starting punishment 1 = waiting for punishment 2 = hearing punishment 3 = outcome of punishment
      Returns:
      the current punishment status

    • isFirstDeal

      public boolean isFirstDeal()
      Returns whether or not the dealer is dealing for the first time in the round. Indicates if the GUI should say which player is going first.
      Returns:
      true if this is the dealer's first time dealing the cards, false otherwise
